Class Button

java.lang.Object
greenfoot.Actor
Button
public class Button extends greenfoot.Actor
Buttons are images that change appearance when the cursor hovers over them and may do things when clicked. To use them, check if the Button has been clicked and do whatever function needed.
Version:
April 2025
Author:
Angela Wang, Stephanie Xia

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Button(Cursor cursor, boolean isLeft)
    Button constructor - pass user cursor and direction of button (for image setting purposes).
    Button(Cursor cursor, int price)
    Button constructor - pass user cursor,and adjusts the graphic depending on price.
    Button(Cursor cursor, String imageBase)
    Button constructor - pass user cursor, and imageBase (original image that indicates no mouse movement hovering it).

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    act()
    Act checks for if the cursor is hovering above the button and changes the image if yes.

  • Constructor Details

    • Button

      public Button(Cursor cursor, boolean isLeft)
      Button constructor - pass user cursor and direction of button (for image setting purposes). We are aware that the L/R issue could have been solved by flipping the image, but were too short on time to fix.
      Parameters:
      cursor - User's cursor, as created by the World the Button is in
      isLeft - Boolean: if true, button is left-facing (used to determine which button image)

    • Button

      public Button(Cursor cursor, int price)
      Button constructor - pass user cursor,and adjusts the graphic depending on price. Price option limited to 10, 15, 20 as needed for the game. When user mouse hovers over the image, graphics adjust to a second graphic called hoverImage
      Parameters:
      cursor - User's cursor, as created by the World the Button is in
      price - Amount of coins user's must pay for the product -- used in shopWorld

    • Button

      public Button(Cursor cursor, String imageBase)
      Button constructor - pass user cursor, and imageBase (original image that indicates no mouse movement hovering it). hoverImage, which is the graphic adjusted when a mouse is hovering on top of a image, is found based on the name of the imageBase.
      Parameters:
      cursor - User's cursor, as created by the World the Button is in
      imageBase - Image that will be percieved by user before mouse is hovered over the image

  • Method Details

    • act

      public void act()
      Act checks for if the cursor is hovering above the button and changes the image if yes. If the button is clicked, a click sound is played.
      Overrides:
      act in class greenfoot.Actor
